topic.title: OPSx Co-Processor Features Overview

body.p: The GCC TRANS block contains a dedicated co-processor for the Insert Path buffer block management, including multicast support. The offload processor consists of a MIPS 14K processor and wrapper logic. The wrapper logic includes a Generic Interrupt Controller including two 32-bit timers, a 32-bit watchdog timer, and 3 external interrupts. The processor has dedicated 64 k IRAM for program code and 64 k DRAM for program data. 16 k DRAM reserved for messaging. The Host CPU has access to all OPSx registers, GIC registers as well as the GCC TRANS registers. The OPSx has access to the OPSx memory map as well as the GCC TRANS register map. Communication between the Host CPU and the OPSx will be signaled through interrupts set within the OPSx memory map and the 16 k DRAM reserved for the message FIFO. Provisioning of Link Mapping Numbers and GCC Links is performed through this interface.

The OPSx/MIPS14k remains in reset after chip reset is released. The Host CPU will upload IRAM and DRAM while the OPSx remains in reset. Once program and data is uploaded the Host CPU will release the OPSx from reset.
